page.title: 14SOUTH-AYR CASTLEHILL SCHOOL
page.content: Until 1969{Belmont High School}had a primary department. Then a new building was opened to house the primary children. This was built on the site of a former market garden and was called{Castlehill Primary School.} The secondary school was extended to include 5th. and 6th. year pupils and was then called{Belmont Academy.} In 1969 the roll at Castlehill was { {579}but by 1985 it was down to{226}due to the fall in the birth rate and the opening of nearby{Kincaidston Primary {School.}In Castlehill there are now 9 teachers, a Head Teacher, 1 part-time secretary, 1 auxiliary and 1 janitor. At the moment four empty classrooms are being used by{St.John's R.C.School whose own school was destroyed by fire. However their new school should be ready by autumn 1985.
